questions.question: My brother’s very ___________. He never sits at home. He likes going hiking and doing different activities.
We use the present ___________ to talk about things happening now, around now and at the moment.
My mom _________________ me how to cook plov at the moment.
Correct the mistake in the sentence. Right now, I watch basketball.
What’s your address?
Abdulla? I think he ______________ a letter at the moment.

Read the article and choose the best heading for it. Scientists believe the Earth is 4.6 billion years old. However, the mountains, valleys, hills, rivers, deserts and forests we see today are much younger than that. For example, Mount Everest is about 60 million years old and the Amazon rainforest is only 10 million years old. The youngest sea in the world is the Baltic Sea, at about 15,000 years old.
options: Good news in one part of the world

questions.question: That bag __________ to me. It’s my mom’s.
Timmy's mother has three children. The first was named April. The next was named May. What is the final one's name?
If I have it, I don't share it. If I share it, I don't have it. What is it?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
When you rang, I_________ my bike.

Yellowstone is one of the oldest national parks in the world. It is in the USA in the states of Wyoming, Montana and Idaho. It is also a biosphere reserve - a special national park with interesting and unusual plants, animals and landscapes. In Yellowstone, men and women called park rangers look after the animals and plants. Find the FALSE sentence.
options: Yellowstone is part of several states in the USA.
+Park rangers protect the animals and plants in Yellowstone.
The park is a biosphere reserve.

questions.question: Yellowstone is one of the oldest national parks in the world. It is in the USA in the states of Wyoming, Montana and Idaho. It is also a biosphere reserve - a special national park with interesting and unusual plants, animals and landscapes. In Yellowstone, men and women called park rangers look after the animals and plants. Find the word the same meaning: keep safe.
Find all irregular verbs.
Correct the mistakes in the sentence. It is a rainy day on Saturday, so I spended the day at home.
options: It was a rainy day on Saturday, so I spent the day at home
It was a rainy day on Saturday, so I spended the day at home
+It is a rainy day on Saturday, so I spent the day at home
It a rainy day on Saturday, so I spent the day at home

questions.question: John and Jill _______________ their driving tests yet.
A king without a crown.
What is it?
What is it?
Where (you / go) on holiday with your family last year?
Find sentences with the past simple form.
options: I don’t like watching TV with mom
+My mom, sister and I travelled by tram to the underground station.
Have you ever been to Spain?
We are writing essay at the moment.

questions.question: In today's globalized world, knowing a second language is more valuable than ever. It opens doors to new cultures, enhances career prospects, and even improves cognitive functions. Many studies have shown that people who speak more than one language have better problem-solving skills and are more creative. Additionally, learning a new language can improve memory and delay the onset of cognitive decline as we age. What is one cognitive benefit of learning a second language?
options: It only helps when traveling for work

questions.question: One of the most significant advantages of learning another language is the ability to communicate with people from different parts of the world. This skill is particularly useful in the business world, where international collaboration is common. Employers often seek individuals who can speak multiple languages, as it makes them more versatile and capable of working in diverse teams. Moreover, learning a new language allows you to experience different cultures in a more meaningful way. Traveling becomes more enjoyable when you can speak the local language, as it helps you connect with the people and understand their customs better. It can also help you appreciate art, music, and literature from other cultures in their original forms. What aspect of culture becomes easier to appreciate when you know a second language?
She ____________ for the airport an hour ago.
We ___________ each other since we were kids.
I make two people out of one. What am I?
What’s your email address?
A ___________ is a big hill.

Adult giant pandas weigh between 75 and 135 kilograms. Females usually only have one baby panda, or cub, at a time. The cubs only weigh about 85 grams when they are born! The little cub drinks milk for about four months and then begins to eat bamboo. Young pandas stay with their mothers for around 18 months. Find the TRUE sentence.
options: Pandas start eating bamboo at the age of 18 months.
+Baby pandas are very light when they are born.
A cub is a name of little panda.
